truth: -  "Optics is the branch of physics that studies the behavior and properties of light."
fiction: -  "Optics is the branch of physics that studies the behavior and properties of sound."

truth: -  "Refraction is the bending of light as it passes from one medium to another."
fiction: -  "Refraction is the straightening of light as it passes from one medium to another."

truth: -  "A convex lens causes light rays to converge or come together."
fiction: -  "A convex lens causes light rays to diverge or spread apart."

truth: -  "The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second."
fiction: -  "The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per hour."

truth: -  "The color of an object is determined by the wavelengths of light it reflects."
fiction: -  "The color of an object is determined by the wavelengths of sound it reflects."

truth: -  "A prism can separate white light into its component colors."
fiction: -  "A prism can combine all colors into white light."

truth: -  "The human eye can detect light wavelengths from about 400 to 700 nanometers."
fiction: -  "The human eye can detect light wavelengths from about 400 to 700 kilometers."

truth: -  "Polarization is a property of waves that can oscillate with more than one orientation."
fiction: -  "Polarization is a property of waves that can only oscillate with one orientation."

truth: -  "Infrared light has a longer wavelength than visible light."
fiction: -  "Infrared light has a shorter wavelength than visible light."

truth: -  "A mirror reflects light in a way that preserves much of its original quality."
fiction: -  "A mirror absorbs light in a way that preserves much of its original quality."

truth: -  "Fiber optics use the principle of total internal reflection to transmit light."
fiction: -  "Fiber optics use the principle of total external reflection to transmit light."

truth: -  "Ultraviolet light has a shorter wavelength than visible light."
fiction: -  "Ultraviolet light has a longer wavelength than visible light."

truth: -  "A concave lens causes light rays to diverge or spread apart."
fiction: -  "A concave lens causes light rays to converge or come together."

truth: -  "The angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection."
fiction: -  "The angle of incidence is twice the angle of reflection."

truth: -  "Diffraction is the bending of light around the corners of an obstacle or aperture."
fiction: -  "Diffraction is the straightening of light around the corners of an obstacle or aperture."

truth: -  "Interference is the phenomenon in which two light waves superpose to form a resultant wave of greater or lower amplitude."
fiction: -  "Interference is the phenomenon in which two light waves superpose to form a resultant wave of the same amplitude."

truth: -  "A rainbow is formed by refraction, reflection, and dispersion of light in water droplets."
fiction: -  "A rainbow is formed by refraction, reflection, and absorption of light in water droplets."

truth: -  "Laser light is coherent, meaning the waves are all in phase and have the same frequency."
fiction: -  "Laser light is incoherent, meaning the waves are all out of phase and have different frequencies."

truth: -  "The index of refraction is a measure of how much a ray of light bends when it enters a material."
fiction: -  "The index of refraction is a measure of how much a ray of light straightens when it enters a material."

truth: -  "The Doppler effect in light is used to measure the velocity of distant galaxies."
fiction: -  "The Doppler effect in light is used to measure the temperature of distant galaxies."

truth: -  "Holography is a technique that enables a light field to be recorded and later reconstructed."
fiction: -  "Holography is a technique that enables a sound field to be recorded and later reconstructed."

truth: -  "The phenomenon of light emission following absorption of light is called fluorescence."
fiction: -  "The phenomenon of light absorption following emission of light is called fluorescence."

truth: -  "Chromatic aberration in a lens is caused by the lens having a different refractive index for different wavelengths of light."
fiction: -  "Chromatic aberration in a lens is caused by the lens having the same refractive index for different wavelengths of light."

truth: -  "Photons are the fundamental particles of light."
fiction: -  "Electrons are the fundamental particles of light."
